xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This is a library module offering a part of the set of statistical functions defined by Microsoft Excel 2003.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Daniel Turcanu

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Import excel-math module functions.
Function for average function. This function should not be used outside this module. It counts all non-empty arguments from the sequence. The string value of every argument is used for checking.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The count of non-empty string values.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:count-non-empty
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:count-non-empty($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of the arguments. Arguments can be empty values, otherwise must be castable to numeric. If sequence is empty then zero is returned. The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of numbers or empty values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sum of all numbers divided by the number of non-empty values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:average
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:average($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Counts the number of cells that contain numbers or values castable to numeric.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of values, of any length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:count
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:count($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Counts the empty values in a sequence. The empty values are the ones with string value "". The value 0 is not counted.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $cells the sequence of values, of any length

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:countblank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:countblank($cells as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the largest number in a sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:max
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:max($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the smallest number in a sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:min
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:min($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the median of the given numbers. The median is the number in the middle of a set of numbers. Half the numbers have values that are greater than the median, and half the numbers have values that are less than the median.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers, of any length
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: for odd count of numbers return the number in the middle of the sorted sequence. For even count of numbers return the average of the two numbers in the middle.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:median
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:median($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the most frequently occurring, or repetitive, value in a sequence. Arguments must be castable to numeric.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers, of any length
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type
fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if there are no duplicate numbers

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:mode
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:mode($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the k-th percentile of values in a sequence. If k is not a multiple of 1/(n - 1), PERCENTILE interpolates to determine the value at the k-th percentile. The function is computed by (max-min)*k + min
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers, of any length
$k_at the percentile, with value between 0 .. 1 inclusive
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type
excel-err:Num if percentile is not between 0 .. 1

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:percentile
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:percentile($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $k_at as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Function for AVEDEV. This function should not be used outside this module. Computes formula sum(abs(x - average)) for every x in $numbers
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers The sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. Sequence can be of any length.
$average The average of all numbers, computed with function AVERAGE.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:sum-deviations
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:sum-deviations($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $average as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the average of the absolute deviations of data points from their mean. The formula is sum(abs(x - average_x))/n, where n is the count of x in the sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. Sequence can be of any length from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:avedev
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:avedev($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Function for AVERAGEA. This function should not be used outside this module. This function adds all values that are castable to numeric.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers A sequence of any values, any length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:add-all-cells
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:add-all-cells($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of the values in the sequence of arguments. Arguments can be of any type. The numbers are added, and the sum is divided by the size of entire sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of values of any type. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:averagea
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:averagea($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Counts the number of values that are not empty. Empty values are the one with string value "".
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of values of any type, any length

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:counta
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:counta($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the k-th largest value in a data set. If n is the number of data points in a range, then LARGE(array,1) returns the largest value, and LARGE(array,n) returns the smallest value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$k the position of largest value, with value from 1 to count of values
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The k-th largest value as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type
excel-err:Num if the sequence is empty
excel-err:Num if k is not a value between 1 and the sequence size

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:large
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:large($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $k as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the largest value in a list of arguments. In this implementation there is no difference between MAX and MAXA.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:maxa
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:maxa($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the smallest value in a list of arguments. In this implementation there is no difference between MAX and MAXA.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:mina
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:mina($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers. The rank of a number is its size relative to other values in a list. (If you were to sort the list, the rank of the number would be its position.) RANK gives duplicate numbers the same rank.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x The number whose rank you want to find.
$numbers The sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length.
$order_ascending A boolean having the meaning: falsethen rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in descending order. true then rank the number as if the sequence was sorted in ascending order.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:rank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:rank($x as xs:anyAtomicType, $numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $order_ascending as xs:boolean) as xs:decimal

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This RANK function is same as the above, only that $order_ascending is set by default to false.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x The number whose rank you want to find.
$numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:rank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:rank($x as xs:anyAtomicType, $numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:decimal

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the rank of a value in a data set as a percentage of the data set. If x does not match one of the values in array, PERCENTRANK interpolates to return the correct percentage rank.
The formula is uses: (RANK - 1) / (size - 1) .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$x is the value for which you want to know the rank
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type
excel-err:Num if the sequence is zero length

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:percentrank
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:percentrank($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $x as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:decimal

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the quartile of a data set.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

$quart one of the values 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 with meaning: 0 compute minimum value 1 compute first quartile (25th percentile) 2 compute median value (50th percentile) 3 compute third quartile (75th percentile) 4 compute maximum value
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the computed quartile, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type
excel-err:Num if the sequence is zero length
excel-err:Num if $quart is not one of the values 0, 1, 2, 3, 4

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:quartile
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:quartile($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $quart as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This function computes the k-th smallest value in a data set. Use this function to return values with a particular relative standing in a data set. If n is the number of data points in array, SMALL(array,1) equals the smallest value, and SMALL(array,n) equals the largest value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers A sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$k The position (from the smallest) in the sequence of data to return. Must have value between 1 and size of sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.
excel-err:Num if the sequence is zero length.
excel-err:Num if $k is not a value between 1 and the size of sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:small
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:small($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $k as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Function for VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA and SLOPE. This function should not be used outside this module. It computes formula sum((x - average_x)^2) for all x in $numbers.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numbers. The sequence can be of any length.
$average The precomputed average over the sequence.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:sumsq-deviations
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:sumsq-deviations($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $average as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1).
average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.
n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:var
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:var($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Estimates variance based on a sample.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / (n - 1).
average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.
n is the size of sequence, including empty values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:vara
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:vara($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n.
average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.
n is the count of numbers from the sequence, excluding empty values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:varp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:varp($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Calculates variance based on the entire population.
The formula is sum(x - average_x)^2 / n.
average_x is computed with AVERAGE function.
n is the size of sequence, including empty values.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $numbers the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:varpa
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:varpa($numbers as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Function for PROB function. This function should not be used outside this module. Computes the sum over a sequence of numbers. Checks if the values are between 0 and 1.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $prob_range The sequence of probabilities.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sum of probabilities. This should be 1.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Num if any probability is not between 0 and 1.
excel-err:Value if any parameter is not castable to numeric.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:sum-prob
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:sum-prob($prob_range as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Function for PROB function. This function should not be used outside this module. Checks the prob range and x range if they have the same number of values. Adds all probabilities corresponding to values between range_lower_limit and upper_limit.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_range The sequence of x values.
$prob_range The sequence of probabilies associated to x values.
$range_lower_limit The lower limit of the range to compute the probability.
$upper_limit The upper limit of the range to compute the probability.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if any parameter is not castable to numeric.
excel-err:Num if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:sum-prob-x
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:sum-prob-x($x_range as xs:anyAtomicType*, $prob_range as xs:anyAtomicType*, $range_lower_limit as xs:anyAtomicType, $upper_limit as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the probability that values in a range are between two limits.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_range is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.
$prob_range is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.
$range_lower_limit is the lower bound on the value for which you want a probability.
$upper_limit is the upper bound on the value for which you want a probability.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The probability of the entire range
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Num if any probability is not between 0 and 1
excel-err:Num if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1
excel-err:Value if any parameter is not castable to numeric
excel-err:Num if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:prob
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:prob($x_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $prob_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $range_lower_limit as xs:anyAtomicType, $upper_limit as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This is the same as above, only that upper_limit is not specified. The probability is computed only for range_lower_limit.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_range is the range of numeric values of x with which there are associated probabilities. This does not need to be ordered.
$prob_range is a set of probabilities associated with values in x_range.
$range_lower_limit is the value for which you want a probability.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The probability of the range_lower_limit value
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Num if any probability is not between 0 and 1
excel-err:Num if the sum of probabilities is not equal to 1
excel-err:Value if any parameter is not castable to numeric
excel-err:Num if x_range and prob_range do not have the same number of values

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:prob
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:prob($x_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $prob_range as xs:anyAtomicType+, $range_lower_limit as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Function for SLOPE function. This function should not be used outside this module. It computes the formula:
sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y))
where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x_numbers The sequence of x numbers.
$x_average The precomputed AVERAGE over the x_numbers.
$y_numbers The sequence of y numbers.
$y_average The precomputed AVERAGE over the y_numbers.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The formula result, as numeric type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if any parameter cannot be casted to numeric.
fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if there are different numbers of x's and y's.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:sum-x-y-deviations
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel:sum-x-y-deviations($x_numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $x_average as xs:anyAtomicType, $y_numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*, $y_average as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns the slope of the linear regression line through data points in known_y's and known_x's. The slope is the vertical distance divided by the horizontal distance between any two points on the line, which is the rate of change along the regression line. It computes the formula:
sum((x - average_x)(y - average_y)) / sum((x - average_x)^2)
where average_x and average_y are computed with AVERAGE function.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $known_y the sequence of y numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
$known_x the sequence of x numbers. The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The slope value, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if any parameter cannot be casted to numeric
fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if there are different numbers of x's and y's
fn:QName("http://zorba.io/modules/excel/errors", "excel-err:NA") if any sequence is empty
excel-err:Div0 if all x's are equal

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:slope
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:slope($known_y as xs:anyAtomicType+, $known_x as xs:anyAtomicType+) as xs:anyAtomicType

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Returns a normalized value from a distribution characterized by mean and standard_dev.
The formula is (x - mean) / standard_dev .
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $x is the value you want to normalize
$mean is the arithmetic mean of the distribution.
$standard_dev is the standard deviation of the distribution.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The normalized x, as numeric type
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if any parameter cannot be casted to numeric
excel-err:Num if standard_dev is a value smaller than zero or equal

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel:standardize
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel:standardize($x as xs:anyAtomicType, $mean as xs:anyAtomicType, $standard_dev as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:double
